ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: The course goes over many tools for creating and editing music through the application Ableton Live. You are also taught the basics of music theory through the course, such as reading music, different types of percussion, and chord progressions. You also learn about the history of EDM: early synthesizers and drum machines. The class also covers the major characteristics of a few genres of EDM.
EDM disciplines, production techniques, evolution
knowledge of EDM music origins and how to create basic EDM music.
I learned about the history of Electronic dance music in addition to using Ableton software to create music.
How to read music, how to listen for certain sounds and instruments in music and how to identify them, history of instruments and techniques used in EDM, how to work in Ableton

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course spends a lot of time on different audio effects and tools that can be used within Ableton. These are usually pretty dry and feel a bit unnecessary. It would be better if the slides of the effects were left out of the lectures becauses most of them can be easily found online or just accessed as a resource when you're stuck. The teaching of music fundamentals are great, and I finished the class with a much better understanding of chord progressions. The class includes several projects which allow you to apply the concepts learned, and these can be a lot of fun. It would be great if the class spent more time analyzing different genres of EDM. We went over about 6 of them, and this was very interesting.
Really cool content and structure, perhaps not the most transferrable into quiz settings, more practical modes of assessment would likely be useful
Interesting content, but moved a little fast especially through the music theory part which was confusing for someone with no musical background.
Very interesting class with great assignments, manageable workload, and great professor/ TA. No weaknesses.

Great professor, I think the only weakness is not a fault of the professor but just a sign of the times. It was difficult to get things with an online course at times, and felt like it wouldve been easier in person.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: The class is great for students who are interested in the history of EDM and want to learn how to use Ableton to create music. A lot of time is spent in the class reviewing the different parts of Ableton and how to make music using the program.
For sure! It was really unique and interesting
Yes! Super fun and interesting summer course with not too much work. As someone with no musical background I found the assignments were approachable and help was readily offered where you needed it.
Absolutely
Yes. May be a bit difficult if you have no prior music experience, but definitely worth it if youre a fan of EDM and the TF and Professor are more than willing to help.
